Hi Alex,

It was great meeting you the other day and hearing about your interest in addiction recovery. As promised, here’s a snapshot of what we do at Serenity Path Recovery Center and a few ways you could plug in if you’d like.

What we do
-----------
• Whole-person treatment – We combine medical detox, evidence–based therapies (CBT, DBT, 12-Step facilitation) and holistic practices like mindfulness, yoga and nutrition coaching.
• Multiple program tracks – In-patient residential (28–90 days), Intensive Out-patient, evening Out-patient groups, and stand-alone individual & family counseling make it possible for people to get help without pausing their entire life.
• Family focus – Loved ones are invited into weekly sessions so everyone learns the same communication and relapse-prevention skills.
• Strong after-care – Graduates join weekly alumni groups, have a peer mentor, and can access our 24/7 chat line and mobile “craving-coping” app for a full year.

Impact so far
-------------
Last year 75 % of clients who completed a program were still substance-free six months later (national average hovers near 50 %). We keep therapist caseloads small (max 6 clients) and track anonymous outcomes data so we can keep improving.

Where tech meets recovery
-------------------------
Because you’re in software, you might appreciate that we’re piloting a mobile companion app that delivers just-in-time coping exercises and aggregates usage data (fully anonymized) to personalize care plans. We’re also experimenting with VR mindfulness modules—happy to nerd out on those details if you’re interested!

Ways to get involved
--------------------
• Volunteer: run a Saturday skills workshop (resume building, intro to coding, etc.)
• Mentor: pair with alumni transitioning into tech roles.
• Come visit: I’d be glad to give you a short tour or let you sit in on a non-clinical group session to see the vibe first-hand.

Let me know if any of that piques your interest or if you have questions. Always happy to chat.

Warm regards,

[Your Name]
Program Coordinator, Serenity Path Recovery Center
